channel.title: Homes on Alex Ledger
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Alex Ledger

item.description: Email: a.led1027 <at> gmail <dot> com Github: github.com/aled1027 I am a software engineer and plant enthusiast. If you are interested in learning more about my projects with plants, check out my plant blog. In my day job I am a software engineer focused on building tools for data analysis, privacy, and security. I have experience building data analysis tools, working directly with customers, writing secure, cryptography code, and building privacy-enhancing technologies.

item.title: Interests and Technologies
item.description: Interests Data analysis, Data Visualization, Graph databases, Machine Learning Cryptography, Computer Security, Privacy, Anonymity Technologies Languages C, C++, Python, JavaScript, Java, Rust, Haskell, Clojure, Coq, Latex Data analysis and visualization Python, JavaScript, R, Octave, Mathematica, Matlab Databases SQL, NoSQL, Graph databases, SPARQL Cloud AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Linux, Bash, Git

item.title: Work and Projects
item.description: Plants I am currently working on a variety of projects involving plants. Check out my plant blog to learn more! Framework for Efficient Development of Secure Multi-party Computation At MIT Lincoln Lab, I work on a team designing and developing a framework for secure multi-party computation (MPC) protocols. MPC is a privacy-enhancing, cryptographic technique for securely computing functions on private data - that is, the inputs and all intermediate values are never revealed to anyone.
